description: Retrieves information about the status, configuration, and other settings for all versions of a campaign.

parameters.name: ApplicationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the application. This identifier is displayed as the Project ID on the Amazon Pinpoint console.

parameters.name: CampaignId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the campaign.

nested_items.name: CampaignsResponse
nested_items.description: Provides information about the configuration and other settings for all the campaigns that are associated with an application.

nested_items.name: Item
nested_items.description: An array of responses, one for each campaign that's associated with the application.

nested_items.name: AdditionalTreatments
nested_items.description: An array of responses, one for each treatment that you defined for the campaign, in addition to the default treatment.

nested_items.name: CustomDeliveryConfiguration
nested_items.description: The delivery configuration settings for sending the treatment through a custom channel. This object is required if the MessageConfiguration object for the treatment specifies a CustomMessage object.

nested_items.name: DeliveryUri
nested_items.description: The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can be one of the following:
The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.
The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the HTTPS protocol.

nested_items.name: EndpointTypes
nested_items.description: The types of endpoints to send the campaign or treatment to. Each valid value maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an endpoint by using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the treatment.

nested_items.name: MessageConfiguration
nested_items.description: The message configuration settings for the treatment.

nested_items.name: ADMMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

nested_items.name: ImageIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageSmallIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: JsonBody
nested_items.description: The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.

nested_items.name: MediaUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: RawContent
nested_items.description: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

nested_items.name: SilentPush
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's configuration, displaying messages in an in-app message center, or supporting phone home functionality.

nested_items.name: TimeToLive
nested_items.description: The number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's device.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: APNSMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

nested_items.name: ImageIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageSmallIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: MediaUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.

If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.

nested_items.name: Action

OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's device.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: CustomMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through a custom channel, as specified by the delivery configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration) settings for the campaign. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Data
nested_items.description: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message. The maximum size is 5 KB.

nested_items.name: DefaultMessage
nested_items.description: The default message that the campaign sends through all the channels that are configured for the campaign.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

nested_items.name: ImageIconUrl

This value is converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification service. nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's device.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: EmailMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the email channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the email for recipients whose email clients don't render HTML content.

nested_items.name: FromAddress
nested_items.description: The verified email address to send the email from. The default address is the FromAddress specified for the email channel for the application.

nested_items.name: Headers
nested_items.description: The list of MessageHeaders for the email. You can have up to 15 MessageHeaders for each email.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message header. The header name can contain up to 126 characters.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the message header. The header value can contain up to 870 characters, including the length of any rendered attributes. For example if you add the {CreationDate} attribute, it renders as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSZ and is 24 characters in length.

nested_items.name: HtmlBody
nested_items.description: The body of the email, in HTML format, for recipients whose email clients render HTML content.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The subject line, or title, of the email.

nested_items.name: GCMMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the GCM channel, which enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

nested_items.name: ImageIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageSmallIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: JsonBody
nested_items.description: The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.

nested_items.name: MediaUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: RawContent
nested_items.description: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: SMSMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the SMS channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the SMS message.

nested_items.name: MessageType
nested_items.description: The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing messages).

nested_items.name: OriginationNumber
nested_items.description: The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example, +12065550100.

nested_items.name: SenderId
nested_items.description: The sender ID to display on recipients' devices when they receive the SMS message.

nested_items.name: EntityId
nested_items.description: The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.

nested_items.name: TemplateId
nested_items.description: The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.

nested_items.name: InAppMessage
nested_items.description: The in-app message configuration.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

nested_items.name: Content
nested_items.description: In-app message content.

nested_items.name: BackgroundColor
nested_items.description: The background color for the message.

nested_items.name: BodyConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the message body.

nested_items.name: Alignment
nested_items.description: The alignment of the text. Valid values: LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: Message Body.

nested_items.name: TextColor
nested_items.description: The text color.

nested_items.name: HeaderConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the message header.

nested_items.name: Alignment
nested_items.description: The alignment of the text. Valid values: LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT.

nested_items.name: Header
nested_items.description: Message Header.

nested_items.name: TextColor
nested_items.description: The text color.

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: The image url for the background of message.

nested_items.name: PrimaryBtn
nested_items.description: The first button inside the message.

nested_items.name: ButtonAction
nested_items.description: Action triggered by the button.

nested_items.name: Link
nested_items.description: Button destination.

nested_items.name: DefaultConfig

nested_items.description: The border radius of the button.

nested_items.name: CustomConfig
nested_items.description: Custom config to be sent to client.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Layout
nested_items.description: In-app message layout.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or will end.

nested_items.name: EventFilter
nested_items.description: The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of the Frequency property is EVENT.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: The dimension settings of the event filter for the campaign.

nested_items.name: Attributes
nested_items.description: One or more custom attributes that your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you create an event filter.

nested_items.name: AttributeType
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: AttributeType
nested_items.description: The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are:
INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are included in the segment.
EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are excluded in the segment.
CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values are included in the segment.
BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes before the value are included in the segment.
AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after the value are included in the segment.
ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes between the values are included in the segment.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the value of the AttributeType property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their attribute values match the criteria values.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EventType
nested_items.description: The name of the event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey activity to be performed. This can be a standard event that Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as _email.delivered. For campaigns, this can also be a custom event that's specific to your application. For information about standard events, see Streaming Amazon Pinpoint Events in the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: DimensionType
nested_items.description: The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and, EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the segment.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: The operator to use when comparing metric values. Valid values are: GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, and EQUAL.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value to compare.

nested_items.name: FilterType
nested_items.description: The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT, sends the campaign when an endpoint event (Events resource) occurs.

nested_items.name: Frequency
nested_items.description: Specifies how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is sent in response to a specific event.

nested_items.name: IsLocalTime
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each recipient's local time, set this value to true.

nested_items.name: QuietTime
nested_items.description: The default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the following conditions are met:
The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set to a valid value.
The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the campaign.
The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the campaign.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time in ISO 8601 format.

nested_items.name: Timezone
nested_items.description: The starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.

nested_items.name: SizePercent
nested_items.description: The allocated percentage of users (segment members) that the treatment is sent to.

nested_items.name: CampaignStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.

nested_items.name: TemplateConfiguration
nested_items.description: The message template to use for the treatment.

nested_items.name: EmailTemplate
nested_items.description: The email template to use for the message.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: PushTemplate
nested_items.description: The push notification template to use for the message.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: SMSTemplate
nested_items.description: The SMS template to use for the message.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: VoiceTemplate
nested_items.description: The voice template to use for the message. This object isn't supported for campaigns.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: InAppTemplate
nested_items.description: The InApp template to use for the message. The InApp template object is not supported for SendMessages.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: TreatmentDescription
nested_items.description: The custom description of the treatment.

nested_items.name: TreatmentName
nested_items.description: The custom name of the treatment.

nested_items.name: ApplicationId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the application that the campaign applies to.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was created.

nested_items.name: CustomDeliveryConfiguration
nested_items.description: The delivery configuration settings for sending the campaign through a custom channel.

nested_items.name: DeliveryUri
nested_items.description: The destination to send the campaign or treatment to. This value can be one of the following:
The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Lambda function to invoke to handle delivery of the campaign or treatment.
The URL for a web application or service that supports HTTPS and can receive the message. The URL has to be a full URL, including the HTTPS protocol.

nested_items.name: EndpointTypes
nested_items.description: The types of endpoints to send the campaign or treatment to. Each valid value maps to a type of channel that you can associate with an endpoint by using the ChannelType property of an endpoint.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DefaultState
nested_items.description: The current status of the campaign's default treatment. This value exists only for campaigns that have more than one treatment.

nested_items.name: CampaignStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The custom description of the campaign.

nested_items.name: HoldoutPercent
nested_items.description: The allocated percentage of users (segment members) who shouldn't receive messages from the campaign.

nested_items.name: LambdaFunctionName
nested_items.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Lambda function that Amazon Pinpoint invokes to customize a segment for a campaign.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: The mode that Amazon Pinpoint uses to invoke the AWS Lambda function. Possible values are:
FILTER - Invoke the function to customize the segment that's used by a campaign.

DELIVERY - (Deprecated) Previously, invoked the function to send a campaign through a custom channel. This functionality is not supported anymore. To send a campaign through a custom channel, use the CustomDeliveryConfiguration and CampaignCustomMessage objects of the campaign.

nested_items.name: WebUrl
nested_items.description: The web URL that Amazon Pinpoint calls to invoke the AWS Lambda function over HTTPS.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the campaign.

nested_items.name: IsPaused
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the campaign is paused. A paused campaign doesn't run unless you resume it by changing this value to false.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign was last modified.

nested_items.name: Daily
nested_items.description: The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period. For an application, this value specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns and journeys can send to a single endpoint during a 24-hour period. The maximum value is 100.

nested_items.name: MaximumDuration
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that a campaign can attempt to deliver a message after the scheduled start time for the campaign. The minimum value is 60 seconds.

nested_items.name: MessagesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send each second. For an application, this value specifies the default limit for the number of messages that campaigns can send each second. The minimum value is 1. The maximum value is 20,000.

nested_items.name: Total
nested_items.description: The maximum number of messages that a campaign can send to a single endpoint during the course of the campaign. If a campaign recurs, this setting applies to all runs of the campaign. The maximum value is 100.

nested_items.name: Session
nested_items.description: The maximum total number of messages that the campaign can send per user session.

nested_items.name: MessageConfiguration
nested_items.description: The message configuration settings for the campaign.

nested_items.name: ADMMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the ADM (Amazon Device Messaging) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

nested_items.name: ImageIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageSmallIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: JsonBody
nested_items.description: The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.

nested_items.name: MediaUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: RawContent
nested_items.description: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

nested_items.name: SilentPush
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the notification is a silent push notification, which is a push notification that doesn't display on a recipient's device. Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's configuration, displaying messages in an in-app message center, or supporting phone home functionality.

nested_items.name: TimeToLive
nested_items.description: The number of seconds that the push-notification service should keep the message, if the service is unable to deliver the notification the first time. This value is converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification service. If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's device.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: APNSMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the APNs (Apple Push Notification service) channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: CustomMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through a custom channel, as specified by the delivery configuration (CustomDeliveryConfiguration) settings for the campaign. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Data
nested_items.description: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the message. The maximum size is 5 KB.

nested_items.name: DefaultMessage
nested_items.description: The default message that the campaign sends through all the channels that are configured for the campaign.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

nested_items.name: ImageIconUrl

nested_items.name: ImageSmallIconUrl

This value is converted to an expiration value when it's sent to a push-notification service. nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The title to display above the notification message on a recipient's device.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: EmailMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the email channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the email for recipients whose email clients don't render HTML content.

nested_items.name: FromAddress
nested_items.description: The verified email address to send the email from. The default address is the FromAddress specified for the email channel for the application.

nested_items.name: Headers
nested_items.description: The list of MessageHeaders for the email. You can have up to 15 MessageHeaders for each email.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message header. The header name can contain up to 126 characters.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the message header. The header value can contain up to 870 characters, including the length of any rendered attributes. For example if you add the {CreationDate} attribute, it renders as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSZ and is 24 characters in length.

nested_items.name: HtmlBody
nested_items.description: The body of the email, in HTML format, for recipients whose email clients render HTML content.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The subject line, or title, of the email.

nested_items.name: GCMMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the GCM channel, which enables Amazon Pinpoint to send push notifications through the Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM), formerly Google Cloud Messaging (GCM), service. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action to occur if a recipient taps the push notification. Valid values are:
OPEN_APP - Your app opens or it becomes the foreground app if it was sent to the background. This is the default action.
DEEP_LINK - Your app opens and displays a designated user interface in the app. This setting uses the deep-linking features of iOS and Android.
URL - The default mobile browser on the recipient's device opens and loads the web page at a URL that you specify.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the notification message. The maximum number of characters is 200.

nested_items.name: ImageIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the push-notification icon, such as the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageSmallIconUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image to display as the small, push-notification icon, such as a small version of the icon for the app.

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of an image to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: JsonBody
nested_items.description: The JSON payload to use for a silent push notification.

nested_items.name: MediaUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the image or video to display in the push notification.

nested_items.name: RawContent
nested_items.description: The raw, JSON-formatted string to use as the payload for the notification message. If specified, this value overrides all other content for the message.

Silent push notifications can be used for cases such as updating an app's configuration, displaying messages in an in-app message center, or supporting phone home functionality.

If this value is 0, the service treats the notification as if it expires immediately and the service doesn't store or try to deliver the notification again.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL to open in a recipient's default mobile browser, if a recipient taps the push notification and the value of the Action property is URL.

nested_items.name: SMSMessage
nested_items.description: The message that the campaign sends through the SMS channel. If specified, this message overrides the default message.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The body of the SMS message.

nested_items.name: MessageType
nested_items.description: The SMS message type. Valid values are TRANSACTIONAL (for messages that are critical or time-sensitive, such as a one-time passwords) and PROMOTIONAL (for messsages that aren't critical or time-sensitive, such as marketing messages).

nested_items.name: OriginationNumber
nested_items.description: The long code to send the SMS message from. This value should be one of the dedicated long codes that's assigned to your AWS account. Although it isn't required, we recommend that you specify the long code using an E.164 format to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of the message. For example, +12065550100.

nested_items.name: SenderId
nested_items.description: The sender ID to display on recipients' devices when they receive the SMS message.

nested_items.name: EntityId
nested_items.description: The entity ID or Principal Entity (PE) id received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.

nested_items.name: TemplateId
nested_items.description: The template ID received from the regulatory body for sending SMS in your country.

nested_items.name: InAppMessage
nested_items.description: The in-app message configuration.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: The message body of the notification, the email body or the text message.

nested_items.name: Content
nested_items.description: In-app message content.

nested_items.name: BackgroundColor
nested_items.description: The background color for the message.

nested_items.name: BodyConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the message body.

nested_items.name: Alignment
nested_items.description: The alignment of the text. Valid values: LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT.

nested_items.name: Body
nested_items.description: Message Body.

nested_items.name: TextColor
nested_items.description: The text color.

nested_items.name: HeaderConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the message header.

nested_items.name: Alignment
nested_items.description: The alignment of the text. Valid values: LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT.

nested_items.name: Header
nested_items.description: Message Header.

nested_items.name: TextColor
nested_items.description: The text color.

nested_items.name: ImageUrl
nested_items.description: The image url for the background of message.

nested_items.name: PrimaryBtn
nested_items.description: The first button inside the message.

nested_items.name: ButtonAction
nested_items.description: Action triggered by the button.

nested_items.name: Link
nested_items.description: Button destination.

nested_items.name: DefaultConfig
nested_items.description: Default button content.

nested_items.name: BackgroundColor
nested_items.description: The background color of the button.

nested_items.name: BorderRadius
nested_items.description: The border radius of the button.

nested_items.name: ButtonAction
nested_items.description: Action triggered by the button.

nested_items.name: Link
nested_items.description: Button destination.

nested_items.name: Text
nested_items.description: Button text.

nested_items.description: The text color of the button.

nested_items.description: Action triggered by the button.

nested_items.description: Button destination.

nested_items.name: CustomConfig
nested_items.description: Custom config to be sent to client.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Layout
nested_items.description: In-app message layout.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the campaign.

nested_items.name: EndTime
nested_items.description: The scheduled time, in ISO 8601 format, when the campaign ended or will end.

nested_items.name: EventFilter
nested_items.description: The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent, if the value of the Frequency property is EVENT.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: The dimension settings of the event filter for the campaign.

nested_items.name: Attributes
nested_items.description: One or more custom attributes that your application reports to Amazon Pinpoint. You can use these attributes as selection criteria when you create an event filter.

nested_items.name: AttributeType
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: AttributeType
nested_items.description: The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are:
INCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are included in the segment.
EXCLUSIVE - endpoints that have attributes matching the values are excluded in the segment.
CONTAINS - endpoints that have attributes' substrings match the values are included in the segment.
BEFORE - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes before the value are included in the segment.
AFTER - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes after the value are included in the segment.
ON - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT dates on the value are included in the segment. Time is ignored in this comparison.
BETWEEN - endpoints with attributes read as ISO_INSTANT datetimes between the values are included in the segment.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the value of the AttributeType property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their attribute values match the criteria values.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EventType
nested_items.description: The name of the event that causes the campaign to be sent or the journey activity to be performed. This can be a standard event that Amazon Pinpoint generates, such as _email.delivered. For campaigns, this can also be a custom event that's specific to your application. For information about standard events, see Streaming Amazon Pinpoint Events in the Amazon Pinpoint Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: DimensionType
nested_items.description: The type of segment dimension to use. Valid values are: INCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are included in the segment; and, EXCLUSIVE, endpoints that match the criteria are excluded from the segment.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: The criteria values to use for the segment dimension. Depending on the value of the DimensionType property, endpoints are included or excluded from the segment if their values match the criteria values.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: The operator to use when comparing metric values. Valid values are: GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL, and EQUAL.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value to compare.

nested_items.name: FilterType
nested_items.description: The type of event that causes the campaign to be sent. Valid values are: SYSTEM, sends the campaign when a system event occurs; and, ENDPOINT, sends the campaign when an endpoint event (Events resource) occurs.

nested_items.name: Frequency
nested_items.description: Specifies how often the campaign is sent or whether the campaign is sent in response to a specific event.

nested_items.name: IsLocalTime
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the start and end times for the campaign schedule use each recipient's local time. To base the schedule on each recipient's local time, set this value to true.

nested_items.name: QuietTime
nested_items.description: The default quiet time for the campaign. Quiet time is a specific time range when a campaign doesn't send messages to endpoints, if all the following conditions are met:
The EndpointDemographic.Timezone property of the endpoint is set to a valid value.
The current time in the endpoint's time zone is later than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.Start property for the campaign.
The current time in the endpoint's time zone is earlier than or equal to the time specified by the QuietTime.End property for the campaign.

nested_items.name: StartTime
nested_items.description: The scheduled time when the campaign began or will begin. Valid values are: IMMEDIATE, to start the campaign immediately; or, a specific time in ISO 8601 format.

nested_items.name: Timezone
nested_items.description: The starting UTC offset for the campaign schedule, if the value of the IsLocalTime property is true. Valid values are: UTC, UTC+01, UTC+02, UTC+03, UTC+03:30, UTC+04, UTC+04:30, UTC+05, UTC+05:30, UTC+05:45, UTC+06, UTC+06:30, UTC+07, UTC+08, UTC+09, UTC+09:30, UTC+10, UTC+10:30, UTC+11, UTC+12, UTC+13, UTC-02, UTC-03, UTC-04, UTC-05, UTC-06, UTC-07, UTC-08, UTC-09, UTC-10, and UTC-11.

nested_items.name: SegmentId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the segment that's associated with the campaign.

nested_items.name: SegmentVersion
nested_items.description: The version number of the segment that's associated with the campaign.

nested_items.name: CampaignStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the campaign, or the current status of a treatment that belongs to an A/B test campaign.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TemplateConfiguration
nested_items.description: The message template that's used for the campaign.

nested_items.name: EmailTemplate
nested_items.description: The email template to use for the message.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: PushTemplate
nested_items.description: The push notification template to use for the message.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: SMSTemplate
nested_items.description: The SMS template to use for the message.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: VoiceTemplate
nested_items.description: The voice template to use for the message. This object isn't supported for campaigns.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: InAppTemplate
nested_items.description: The InApp template to use for the message. The InApp template object is not supported for SendMessages.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the name of an existing message template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the message template to use for the message. If specified, this value must match the identifier for an existing template version. To retrieve a list of versions and version identifiers for a template, use the Template Versions resource.

nested_items.name: TreatmentDescription
nested_items.description: The custom description of the default treatment for the campaign.

nested_items.name: TreatmentName
nested_items.description: The custom name of the default treatment for the campaign, if the campaign has multiple treatments. A treatment is a variation of a campaign that's used for A/B testing.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version number of the campaign.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: Defines the priority of the campaign, used to decide the order of messages displayed to user if there are multiple messages scheduled to be displayed at the same moment.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The string to use in a subsequent request to get the next page of results in a paginated response. This value is null if there are no additional pages.
